page.title: 13FARMING (2)
page.content: The local{Market Gardener}owns 3 acres on which he grows pyrethrums, delphiniums and sea lavender. Inside the 9 greenhouses he grows dianthus and peppers.The site was previously an orchard. Days{Nursery}has 22 glass and 2 plastic greenhouses on 3 acres of land.About 7,000 plants are grown in each house, heated by oil fired fans. Chrysanthemums and stocks are transported to London and sold at Covent Garden.Every year the greenhouses are sterilised with the poisonous bromide gas so they must be sealed for 10 days.Specialists carry out this work.The busiest time of the year is between October and December. Many of the{orchards}in the village have disappeared as new housing estates have been developed.
